intro: Rochefortia septentrionalis, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky plains. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem and the ability to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Rochefortia septentrionalis is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient species in harsh desert conditions.
